intro: Pimpinella candolleana var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
